alert.note: Alert for Baldwin Peninsula and Selawik Valley; Chukchi Sea Coast; Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills; Lower Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Northern and Interior Seward Peninsula; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast; Yukon Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 04 at 4:17PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...High Surf and Blizzard Conditions Possible from the Yukon Delta to the Bering Strait Monday and Monday Night... ...High Surf and Blizzard Conditions Possible from the Bering Strait to Point Hope Monday Night and Tuesday... A storm moving north over the Eastern Bering Sea on Monday and Monday night will move into the southern Chukchi Sea on Tuesday. This storm could bring southerly gales with chance of high surf to the West Coast of Alaska from Hooper Bay to the Bering Strait on Monday and Monday night. There is also a chance of rain, snow, blowing snow and near blizzard conditions with this storm on Monday and Monday night. The southerly gales, a chance of high surf and blizzard conditions are possible along the West Coast from the Bering Strait to Point Hope Monday night and Tuesday. There is still some uncertainty about this storm on Monday and Tuesday.
